description: Simple yet efficient
I use Pinta to do what I used to do with Paint under Windows. Works perfectly for me.
I've installed this before, and it definately does not use 1GB of space as the listing here says?

description: simple, easy, awesome
just learn a thing or two from microsoft paint
Works fine in Arch Linux, those giving 1 star reviews must have a very specific distro issue not related to the app itself. Simple and works as intented, the UI has some space for improvement.
it is good but there are some that needed to fix with it
summary: does'nt paste the layers and cut it

description: I've been using this for a few years on Arch, a nice lightweight easy alternative to GIMP for doing more basic image tasks

Simple editor for simple needs. Loads quickly and goes away when you're done. Doesn't feel like you're trying to steer and oil tanker like some other apps or that it's only for the little kiddie winks.
summary: Does what I needed it to. Draw red lines around stuff

description: Installed flatpak which worked right out of the box. Performs the simple tasks I need admirably. Its a nice alternative to complex image editors.
Of those simplistic image editors, Pinta does its job very nicely. All the basic functions for small tweaks are there. Free and open source too.
Great app for simple editing of images, an MS Paint alternative. Look and feel is a bit dated though.

I was a huge fan of Paint.net on Windows. So much so that I considered not going to Linux just so I'd have that app. I eventually just decided to use Paint.net on GNOME boxes, but I found this today and I love it. Same quality as Paint.net on Windows, but could use a bit more polish.
Intuitive and useful application.
it's very easy to use it's pretty close to paint.net so it's very easy to use but the big problem with this program is how often it crashes if it weren't for that it'd be a really good program
Whilst I would recommend this app, numerous bugs are still present. It's an improvement over the old one; however there's still lots of work to be done.

Got this error when trying to update on Fedora flatpak
Info: org.gnome.Platform//3.38 is end-of-life, with reason:
The GNOME 3.38 runtime is no longer supported as of August 19, 2021. Please ask your application developer to migrate to a supported platform.
Applications using this runtime:  com.github.PintaProject.Pinta
summary: The GNOME 3.38 runtime is no longer supported as of August 19, 2021

description: I used Pinta earlier without any major issues, and decided to install it again after a couple of years to have a quick annotation tool. Version 1.7, installed from Snap. It appeared to be awfully slow and unresponsive (at least with selection, rectangle and text tools) and also buggy (at least with the text tool). Uninstalled almost instantly and went back to heavier but stable Gimp.
The best alternative to MS paint on gnu/linux
There are better options.
It loads fasts and does what I need. No crazy ui scaling and 20 seconds to load.
summary: A simple to use image editor

description: perfect when you want to save and/or crop screenshots

Works fine for me, Ubuntu 20.04.3

To all that say it crashed, please mention your OS. It would be very helpful.

I have been looking for a simple app to edit images, crop, re-size and add annotations and minimum tweaks here and there. This was the answer!!
Thanks to the developer
other one crashing download this
Based on Paint.Net
It makes screenshot drawing easier
Pinta 2.0 was a major release in December 2021 porting the code to GTK3. I love Pinta as a cross-platform app for quick image edits without having to launch other image editing software.
summary: Love it again since Pinta 2.0 release!

description: It will do the basic image editing pretty well. I liked its simplicity.

Latest version is a massive step up.

However, I'm running a 4K monitor with a dark theme and there are still issues with tiny icons and theming on some text.

But this is not to detract. Pinta fits the gap between a too basic editor and the frightening monstrosities that are Gimp and Krita. A middle-ground image editor like this is essential on Linux.

Credit to the author -- thank you.
Crashes every 5-10 minutes, layer selection will change while using brush or selection (etc) tools,
summary: Unstable, frequency of errors makes the software unusable

description: This is such a good app! It even runs on my Ubuntu laptop!
Thanks Really helped and got me out of a tight spot in a hurry with some nifty edits
summary: Does exactly what it says on the tin

description: Crashed, taking my work with it
I use it since a long time :-)
It crashed when I tried to save my work. Everything lost!
Works great without any problems, but it needs dark mode
This is what I'm looking for... easy to use... Thanks
Simple, beatiful and have a lot of basic functions which i needed!
i think this is perfekt

This is really quite a nice program and it works fine on Kubuntu. The only issue I noticed with this snap is that the dashed lines don't work in the application. Of the various dashed lines that you are supposed to be able to draw only two worked for me and only randomly. Otherwise it is a very nice little program that I would like to continue to use. Also if I could add old photoshop filters and additonal brushes that would be cool. Perhaps the developers could create a tool that converts brushes for other programs to use in this application. A preference setting where you could make the tools a bit larger for those of us that need glasses would also be great.
how do you even resize an image in a selection?
Simple and intuitive
Dont forget to give permission for correct working
summary: Dont forget to give permission for correct working

description: I could use it only once!

A lot of recent reviews says the app doesn't launch or crashes. At least on Fedora 36 flatpak install, it works well. No crashes so far. It's an easy to use, basic editor with the most common features easy to find. When pasting an screenshot, it's smart enough to ask to resize the canvas.

 Doesn't have a recent files open option, but the normal Open file dialog has Recents. Image cropping is not 100% obvious.
summary: Works well for me, Fedora 36 Flatpak install

description: Version 2.0.2 works very well, installed via flatpak. Very much paint.net on windows. Just what is needed for general use.
summary: Great app very much like paint.net on windows

description:
Last version I had was 1.7 and the text selection toolbar was messed up and very hard to use. I've been using this for years, probably since version 1.2 or so. 1.7 worked OK, best release was on a developer repository. Then, no crashes!
Version 2.0.2 has a new toolbox for selection tools that I don't particularly like (a single row down the side, then color selector at the bottom) instead of the classic 1.6 or 1.7 toolboxes (double rows along side only.) 
I think 2.0.1 was actually a better release but is unavailable unless you build it yourself.
Version 2.0.2 is available in Flatpak, easy to install and run, but if you want it in your menus you have to manually put it there. And, maybe because it's Flatpak, the save as dialog opens at some weird location by default, you'll have to be sure to manually select your folder to save in! Also I noticed the program freezes if you try to save more than once, then close. But a dialog "force quit" pops up, so I guess that's the workaround.
ssss ss good!!
Zeitverschwendung
Grundlegende Funktion i.O. konnte keine Fehler feststellen.
Sin duda la recomiendo. Bastante ligera. Ideal para edición rápida.
summary: Aplicación ligera para editar rápidamente imágenes, recomendada

description: es un programa basico pero sirve de mucho
Es muy buena y super rapida me encanta que permite hacer cambios solo en una selección
summary: esta muy buena esta app tiene muchas funciones avanzadas

description: Es de los pocos que son simple de usar y tiene las funciones esenciales

I was using paint.net in a VM before discovering this soft.
It's similar to paint.net in many ways.
Really simple to use and works perfectly

Gimp was to complicated, Krita too.
Pinta is perfect, nice UX and sleek UI. Thanks!

Après GIMP, le plus complet et le plus efficace, Krita qui a essayé de faire aussi bien et plus simple, voici enfin un logiciel simple et efficace, inutile de comprendre GIMP et ses subtilités, voici un logiciel facile à utiliser et donnant enfin la capacité aux débutants sous Linux / Ubuntu de pouvoir faire du dessis ou de la retouche Photo sans prendre peur. 
Très utile pour tagguer les photos de documents officiels avant leur envoi / partage avec toutes nos administrations et autres commerçants.
Тут всё удобно и легко, но есть 1 минус, а именно когда нарисовал что-то, то появляются квадраты, но они со временем пропадают.
Для начинающих художников самое то!
Если вам не нужен тяжелый редактор, то это приложение для вас.
